title: (x) My Bloody Valentine - Wexford {Mark S}
content:
I've been trying to figure this one out for ages:   
   
 [http://www.rotovibe.com/files/mbv\_font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141318/http:/www.rotovibe.com/files/mbv_font.jpg)   
   
additional samples:   
 [http://cgi.di.uoa.gr/~postg21/Graphics/JPEGs/YouMadeMeRealise.JPEG](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141318/http:/cgi.di.uoa.gr/~postg21/Graphics/JPEGs/YouMadeMeRealise.JPEG)   
 [http://cgi.di.uoa.gr/~postg21/Graphics/JPEGs/IsntAnything.JPEG](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141318/http:/cgi.di.uoa.gr/~postg21/Graphics/JPEGs/IsntAnything.JPEG)   
   
I've looked at numerous Bauhaus styles and it looks closest to Chalet Paris 70 which isn't quite right.   
   
Any help is very much appreciated!   
-Spencer
author: spencermfi

comments.content: Wexford Medium. No digital version exists as far as I can tell.

I couldn't find it online. Here's a scan from the incomparable Phil's Photo Homage to the Alphabet (1980):   
   
 ![wexford](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141318im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/20836.gif)
It looked very familiar to me right away, especially the "R." I would have ID'd it sooner, but one of my sourcebooks mis-identified it as Ronda, and I knew that couldn't be right. Feh!
also, regarding the lack of an electronic version - subsequent reissues of these CDs have resorted to plain old Bauhaus...
